intro: Yinshania rupicola subsp. shuangpaiensis, commonly known as the Shuangpai yinshania, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, adapting to poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
